Tasks.Task Description: Use Azure Monitor to continuously track the health and performance of the Azure SignalR Service. Set up alerts for any service disruptions or anomalies.
Regularly check the connection limits and usage statistics to ensure the service is operating within expected thresholds. Scale the service if necessary.
Review and update security policies, including access keys and firewall rules, to ensure the service is protected against unauthorized access.
Regularly back up the configuration settings of the Azure SignalR Service to ensure quick recovery in case of accidental changes or service issues.
Perform failover tests to verify that the service can recover from disruptions and maintain availability during outages.
Conduct regular audits of service usage to ensure compliance with organizational policies and identify any unusual activity.
Analyze performance metrics and optimize the service configuration to improve latency and throughput.
Keep documentation up-to-date, including operational procedures, configuration details, and troubleshooting guides for Azure SignalR Service.
Conduct incident response drills to prepare the team for potential service outages or security incidents. Ensure familiarity with procedures and protocols.
Evaluate the SLA performance of Azure SignalR Service. Address any issues or deviations from the agreed SLA metrics.
Develop and execute plans for service upgrades or expansions as needed. Ensure minimal disruption during these activities.
Ensure the operations team participates in regular training to stay updated with new Azure SignalR Service features, best practices, and security measures.
Collect and analyze user feedback regarding Azure SignalR Service performance and reliability. Implement continuous improvements based on this feedback.
